bill_title: revise the criteria required for minor boundary changes of school districts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the criteria required for minor boundary changes of school districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-6-84.1 be amended to read as follows: 13-6-84.1. In all proposed changes in school district boundaries, the following conditions shall prevail: (1) The boundary of the area proposed to be transferred shall be coterminous at some point with the common boundary of the two school districts. Land owned by the federal, state, or local governments and unoccupied land owned by a nonresident individual or corporation may be included in the request; (2) Children must reside within the boundary of the area to be transferred, unless it is an area change initiated by a school board as provided in § 13-6-84.2 ; (3) Those residing within the area proposed to be transferred have maintained residency within that area for at least one year prior to the date of the request; (4) Those residing within the area proposed to be transferred have long term economic and social connections to the district into which the area is proposed to be transferred; (5) Children residing within the area to be transferred are more easily transported to school by the district into which the area is proposed to be transferred; (6) If a child residing within the area to be transferred is in need of special education or special education and related services, the child's educational needs are best met by the district into which the area is proposed to be transferred; and (7) Those residing within the area proposed to be transferred live substantially closer to schools in the district into which the area is proposed to be transferred than they do to schools in their current school district .
